comments:
To reproduce:

1. Create a project.
2. Create a class called "SimpleTableDemo".
3. Copy and paste the code from:
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/uiswing/components/example-1dot4/SimpleTableDemo.java
4. Run the application - it will run without problems.
5. Debug the application - I am getting "An error has occurred. See error log
for more details".

It's pretty anoying - I cannot debug my real application because I am using
similar Java construction (JTable inside JScrollPane) in my real application.

Thanks in advance!
Ivan
I have no problem debugging the code. What errors are you seeing in the log?

(In reply to comment #1)
> I have no problem debugging the code. What errors are you seeing in the log?

Really interesting, I only see bunch of the error below. Using Sun Java 1.5.0,
installed the java and eclipse few days ago. I simply do Run--->Debug and then
hit the "Debug" button. After that I get a dialog box saying: "Unable to create
part:", after I hit "Ok" I get "An error has occurred. See error log for more
details.", this repeats multiple times. Then in the debug window I have
something like a stack dump, which is also below. I would appreciate if you can
help me figure out what's wrong with my setup. Thanks!

"Error Feb 27, 2005 22:25:59.109 Problems occurred when invoking code from
plug-in: "org.eclipse.core.runtime".

"Thread [AWT-EventQueue-0] (Suspended (exception ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException))

The debugger automatically suspends at uncaught exceptions. This is a user 
preference that you can set on the "Java > Debug" preference page. If you 
press resume, or disable the preference, execution should continue.
I'm running on Mac with 1.4.2. I don't have a 1.5 VM to try.
Works OK for me on WinXP on Java 1.5.0_01.

Haven't had time to get the exact error messages, but I found out that it's a
problem with the workspace. If I create a new directory and switch the workspace
to that directory and then create the project, the problem does not occur. If I
switch back to the other workspace - it's still there.

Do you think I should go ahead and try to figure out what's exactly going on, or
it's not worth it?

Just curious. Is it the workspace or the project? In my workspace I maintain separate projects for SWT 
tests and Swing/AWT tests because the two don't play well together on Mac. Having SWT on the build 
path/classpath causes problems. I don't know what the limitations are on other platforms.
If you create a new Java Project (with defaults settings) in your old workspace and run the 
SimpleTableDemo from that project, does it work?

In fact, I did create a new prject for the SimpleTableDemo and it didn't work.
That's when I decided to post the bug - before that I was thinking it's a bug in
my code:-).

Here is one of the stack traces I get:

Moving to JUI for comment. The trace is a CCE in the java editor.

>Here is one of the stack traces I get:
Please provide all of them.

The CCE is caused by bug 70838. I can't tell the reason why the ErrorEditorPart
is opened since you did not attach all stack traces.

Note: if you switch to the latest I-build the EditorErrorPart will show up (we
added code to prevent the CCE).
